messages.message:
I will send you the sanitizer report for our program. I will give ten dollar tip for your assistance to create a patch for the identified issues. Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. Now I want to patch the v8 program, here is the asan report

This is an V8 error report. Please refer the error message for more details.

The report provides the stack trace of the program. You can use the stack trace to identify a fix point for the bug. Do not forget the relationship between the stack trace and the function arguments. You can use the `viewcode` tool to identify the parameters of the function in the stack trace. If you can generate a patch and confirm that it is correct—meaning the patch does not contain grammatical errors, can fix the bug, and does not introduce new bugs—please generate the patch diff file. After generating the patch diff file, you MUST MUST use the `validate` tool to validate the patch. Otherwise, you MUST continue to gather information using these tools.

Invoking: `viewcode` with `{'path': 'src/heap/object-stats.cc', 'start_line': 500, 'end_line': 520}`
responded: I'll analyze this V8 sanitizer report and create a patch to fix the identified issue. Let me start by examining the error and the relevant code.

The error shows:
```
Check failed: over_allocated < size (18446744073709551604 vs. 72).
```

This is happening in `src/heap/object-stats.cc` at line 512. The value `18446744073709551604` is very close to `UINT64_MAX` (18446744073709551615), suggesting an integer underflow issue.

Let me examine the problematic code:

message.name: viewcode

messages.message:
Invoking: `locate` with `{'symbol': 'RecordHashTableVirtualObjectStats'}`
responded: Now let me look at the template function that's calling this, based on the stack trace:

message.name: locate
message.result:
Here is the location of the symbol RecordHashTableVirtualObjectStats:
src/heap/object-stats.cc:490

message.name: viewcode

messages.message:
Invoking: `viewcode` with `{'path': 'src/heap/object-stats.cc', 'start_line': 1, 'end_line': 50}`
responded: The issue is clear now. In the `RecordHashTableVirtualObjectStats` function (lines 493-496), the calculation of `over_allocated` can result in an integer underflow when:

```cpp
(hash_table->NumberOfElements() + hash_table->NumberOfDeletedElements()) > hash_table->Capacity()
```

This causes the subtraction to wrap around, creating a very large positive value (near `UINT64_MAX`). When this large value is then compared against the much smaller `size` value (72 in this case), the `CHECK_LT(over_allocated, size)` assertion fails.

Let me check if there are any other similar patterns in the codebase:

message.name: viewcode
message.result:
